transportAdvice: Bologna's historic centre is compact and highly walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot; the city also has an extensive bus network that covers tourist areas and the wider city. Taxis are readily available at designated stands near the train station and main piazzas.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional frost; pack warm layers and expect short daylight hours.
Still cool with occasional rain but days begin to lengthen; a light winter coat is essential.
Mild spring conditions arrive with variable weather; a mix of sunny spells and showers is typical.
Pleasant and increasingly warm with frequent sunny days, though afternoon showers are common.
Warm and lush with occasional thunderstorms; one of the most enjoyable months to visit.
Hot and mostly sunny; humidity begins to build and brief thunderstorms can occur in the evenings.
The hottest month with intense heat and high humidity; the famous porticoes provide welcome shade.
Very hot and humid with the city quieter as locals take summer holidays; occasional heavy thunderstorms possible.
Warm and pleasant as summer heat eases; a great month to visit with comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds.
Mild autumn weather with colourful foliage; rain becomes more frequent and a light jacket is advisable.
Cool and often damp with fog becoming a characteristic feature of the Po Valley climate.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets in the piazzas; fog and occasional frost are common.
